summary: Begin Again (Steve Rogers x reader)
body:
Begin Again (Steve Rogers x reader)

♡ took a deep breath in the mirror, he didn’t like it when i wore high heels, but i do ♡


You stood in front of your full length mirror, taking a shaky breath. It had been a while since you had been this dressed up for something, well, someone.

You were wearing your favourite colour, which was rare to you, as they always told you they hated it, and that it didn’t suit you. Seeing yourself in that colour now felt weird, but also quite relieving.

You had been in a relationship with your ex for over two years, and even though you broke up with them months ago, everything they did still played on your mind. The way they would tell you what you could and couldn’t wear, who you could and couldn’t talk to. The way they acted around you made it increasingly difficult to bond with other people after the two of you had broken up, however you had found what appeared to be a bond with Steve Rogers, the guy who had saved your life a month earlier.

It was typical really, you were cornered by a strange man, and Steve just so happened to be passing by and of course he jumped in to save you. He gave you his number (which you didn’t expect, with him being the man out of time and all), and it took you a few weeks to work up the courage to text him, but eventually you did and you both set a date, which was today.


♡ turn the lock and put my headphones on, he always said he didn’t get this song but i do, i do ♡


You sighed to yourself, deciding that you should probably set off to meet Steve at the cafe, you didn’t want to be late for your first date.

You grabbed your purse, house keys, headphones and a jacket, and left your apartment, locking the door and checking it three times.

You pulled your headphones on and plugged your phone in, immediately opening spotify to play your favourite song, it only seemed right that your favourite song could possibly give you good luck on a very important day.

Listening carefully to the song, your mind began to wander to your ex. They always said you had a bad taste in music, that they didn’t understand the songs you listened to, and you had to sit back and agree with them. But you still loved the music you listened to, and you understood every word of them.

Eventually, you sighed and pushed the thoughts of him out of your head, and walked quickly to the cafe where you would be meeting Steve in central Manhattan.


♡ walked in expecting you’d be late but you got here early and you stand and wave, i walk to you. you pull my chair out and help me in, and you don’t know how nice that is, but i do ♡


You stood in front of the cafe where you would meet Steve and took a deep breath, straightening your outfit. You peered inside, looking for him for a few seconds. You didn’t expect him to be there already, but it would be nice if he was.

Eventually, you spotted him, and your face lit up. He was sat in a small corner, and it seemed that as soon as you saw him, he glanced up and made eye contact with you, almost like he knew you were looking over at him.

Steve gave you a small wave and stood up, and you pushed the door to the cafe open and made your way over to where he was sat. You gave him a small smile, “Hi…”

He grinned and pulled out your chair, “Hey, you look…amazing.”

You shook your head, a grin on your features, “Oh, no, I wouldn’t say that….”

He just smiled at you softly, and you smiled back at him. It had been a while since you had smiled genuinely. Your ex never made you feel the way Steve did, appreciated. Everything Steve did seemed to be the opposite of what your ex did, and you loved it.


♡ and you throw your head back laughing like a little kid. i think your strange that you think I’m funny cause he never did ♡


You and Steve had been sat in the cafe talking for an hour about anything and everything. You had taken it in turns to pay for coffee or cake, or whatever the two of you fancied in that moment. You had already written this date down as the best.

You smiled, telling him a story from when you were young, “So, I was in middle school, and we were doing a play, it was like Peter Pan or something. And I was playing a lost boy, so I was on the stage balcony in the hideout or whatever. I said my lines, everything was going perfect, but then I leaned on the side of the balcony and the WHOLE set came crashing down. I was so embarrassed.”

Steve threw his head back in a fit of giggles, and you furrowed your eyebrows in confusion. It’d been a while since anyone had found you that funny.

Steve noticed your expression and frowned a little, “Y/N? Are you alright? Is everything okay?”

You nodded, giving him a small smile, “Yeah, everything’s perfect. I’m just not used to people finding me that funny.”

He grinned, “Well, I think you’re hilarious.”


♡ And we walked down the block, to my car and I almost brought him up. But you start to talk about the movies that your family watches every single Christmas ♡


You stood up from your seat at the small table, and pushed your chair under, whilst Steve did the same. You gave him a small smile, “It’s been so lovely, Steve. Thankyou.”

He grinned, “You’re more than welcome. I’d love to do it again, if you’re interested….”

You nodded, “Of course I am.”

He smiled, his cheeks blushing a light shade of pink, “I’ll…uh…I’ll walk you home. If that’s alright with you.”

You bit your lip to suppress your smile and took his hand, a small wave of confidence overtaking you at his offer, “That would be more than alright with me. Come on.”

You left a tip on the counter of the cafe, and pulled Steve outside, “It’s a little colder than usual.”

Steve smiled at you, “Well, you have a jacket with you. Some of us aren’t so lucky.”

You looked at his bare arms and nodded, “Point taken. I got this jacket for Christmas, like two years ago. It’s not my favourite but it works with what I’m wearing.”

Steve smiled, “Christmas is my fav-”

However, you had started speaking at the same time as him, “My ex bought-”. You bit your lip and looked over at Steve, “You talk.”

He shook his head, “No, by all means. Go ahead.”

You bit your lip, “No, you should really talk. I wanna know why Christmas is your favourite time of year, because it’s also mine.”

Steve gave you a small smile and a nod, “I just enjoy being able to spend time with the rest of the team. There’s no arguments. Everything’s just so nice. Last year we watched Elf on Christmas Eve, and I’ve never seen Thor get so worked up. He was shouting at the tv.”

You giggled, “I can imagine it would be quite frustrating for him.”

“I mean he did spend a week or so trying to get everyone in New Mexico to believe that he was a God from Asgard, so I think he really related to that movie.”


♡ I’ve been spending the last eight months thinking all love ever does is break and burn and end, but on a Wednesday in a cafe, I watched it begin again ♡


You and Steve stopped in front of your apartment building, and you turned to face him, a small smile on your features, “Thankyou for today.”

Steve nodded, “I’ll call you tomorrow, I wanna see you again.” Truth be told, Steve didn’t want to call you tomorrow, he wanted to call you as soon as he got back to the tower, but he didn’t want to seem to overbearing.

You smiled, “I’ll text you later.”

Steve grinned, “I look forward to it.” He turned to start walking away from your apartment, but a small voice inside your head told you to do something you would’ve never imagined yourself doing.

You took a deep breath, walking towards him again, “Steve?”

As soon as he turned back to face you, you grabbed his t shirt and pulled him down so his lips met yours. At first he was unresponsive, but after he got over the initial shock, his lips started to move with yours.

You pulled back and smiled at him, “So, tomorrow?”

He just nodded in response, and gave you a small smile.

title: Archaic Kinds Of Fun
body:
What’s the most impossible job you can think of? For Jo Holbrook, The Tank, Killer Extradonaire…it’s being a bodyguard. Leave it to Fury to kick it up a notch. Now she’s playing chauffeur for Tony Stark and trying to figure out where her life went wrong. At least there’s pancakes.

For The Record

November 1, 2014DARCY“Yo, Skye! You in here?!” Darcy called out as she walked into Tony’s lab. She heard music, and she knew Tony wasn’t playing it because he was out on a date with Pepper…

title: AO3 - Bruce Banner x Tony Stark
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2OjXPG6

by alldairys

Peter Stark is getting married to longtime girlfriend MJ, who is determined to ¨reverse the gender roles¨ so he is simultaneously the groom and bride. This leaves one teensy weensy problem. Who will give him away? Peter decides to ask his father, who has never been an active part of his life. The bigger problem? He has three possible Dads. Stephen Strange, Steve Rogers, and Bruce Banner.

Basically, the Mamma Mia AU that nobody asked for where Peter Parker is Sophie, MJ is Sky, Tony is Donna, and our favorite assassins are Rosie and Tanya.

Updates every Thursday. (And possibly Saturdays as well if I have the time)

summary:
Tilda Swinton knowingly white-washed a Tibetan role AND knowingly signed the Roman Polanski petition.
Benedict Cumberbatch...
body:
Tilda Swinton knowingly white-washed a Tibetan role AND knowingly signed the Roman Polanski petition.

Benedict Cumberbatch white-washed an Indian Sikh role in Star Trek, gave an insanely offensive portrayal of a genderfluid/NB person in Zoolander 2, and decided to play a slaveholder to “honor” the black slaves responsible for building his family’s fortune.

Robert Downey Jr. did black face in Tropic Thunder, and cited it when making a joke about being a “proud black man” after Black Panther came out.

Chris Evans called Black Widow a “whore”, doesn’t defend Scarlett when she is slut-shamed by people using him as a source, and has shown unwavering support for the US Military.

Chris Pratt supports Donald Trump.

Mark Ruffalo supports the removal of Jews from Palestine, and described Wanda Maximoff as a “g**sy” while doing press for Age of Ultron.

Anthony Mackie believes women should “make daddy a sandwich”, and gave Elizabeth Olsen and her roommate a puzzle of his penis as a “housewarming gift”, which made them both very uncomfortable.

Jeremy Renner regularly harasses female fans, called Black Widow a “slut”, half-assed an apology, continued to chant “g**sy” on the Graham Norton show after being told it’s a slur, has made countless disturbing remarks about his female co-stars and their bodies, crashed a stranger’s wedding while being rude the entire time, and GOD KNOWS WHAT ELSE.

… but Scarlett Johansson is the one Marvel should fire.

blog.title: I don't know what I'm doing
blog.description: Welcome. This is where I escape from real life.

summary: Leaving, Part Seven Paring: Tony Stark x reader Warnings: ANGST Word count: 880 A/N: I’M SORRY Tagging: @sherrybaby14...
body:
Leaving, Part Seven

Paring: Tony Stark x reader

Warnings: ANGST

Word count: 880

A/N: I’M SORRY

Tagging: @sherrybaby14 @shitty-imagines-95 @fireflyloki21 @firedolphin04 @hellomissmabel

           I wake to screaming, which is odd because my children are usually so well behaved. Sitting up in bed, I rub my eyes.

           “Friday, what’s going on?” I ask groggily.

           “You should probably go to Jack and James’ room, Mrs. Stark.” She answers.

           That gets me out of bed. I throw a robe on and tie it across my big belly. I quickly make my way to the boys’ room. I am greeted with Jack making Elijah float in the air. Eli is giggling, and Jack is smiling pleasantly. James is hugging his twin and Hudson is clapping his hands. Just inside the door is Pepper with her hands over her mouth.

           “Jackson Howard Stark! You put your brother down this instant!” I say sternly. He jumps and brings his hands to his chest. Suddenly my baby Elijah is falling from the ceiling. Quick on my feet, I slow him down with my mind until I’m under him and then I lightly put him in my arms. Once he’s safe, I turn towards his older brother. “What were you thinking?”

           Jack looks down at his feet. “He thought it was fun.”

           “What if you dropped him and he fell? How would you feel then?” I ask.

           “Really bad.” He sniffs. Tears start streaming down his face. I put Eli on the ground and crouch down in front of him.

           “You know you have to be careful with your brothers. We’ve had this discussion Jack. They are smaller than you. And you also know that using your powers outside of Daddy’s lab is not allowed. Elijah and Hudson don’t have powers yet and can’t defend themselves against you.”

           Tony skids into the room then. “What’s going on? Everyone okay?”

           “I’m handling it.” I say, not looking away from Jack. Pepper takes Tony by the shoulder and escorts him into the hallway to tell him what happened.

           “Do you understand what I’m saying, Jack?”

           “Yes Mama, I’m sorry.” I dry his tears away and kiss his forehead.

           “Why don’t you put in a movie and watch it with your brothers?” I suggest.

           “Okay come on Eli, come on Hudsie.” He takes Eli’s hand and James takes Hudson’s hand and they make their way out into the common room. I hear Pepper say that she’ll make them popcorn.

           I hug myself. In the last twenty weeks since we went to the doctor, James had shown signs of being able to control machines. When we tested it out with one of Tony’s suits, he made it fly without it being on in the first place. We triple checked it wasn’t Friday.

           Tony comes in and rubs my belly. “It’ll be okay.”

           “Will it?”

* * *

           I can’t sleep. I look at the clock again. 1:16. Great. I roll over towards Tony. He’s snoring. It isn’t so bad. Just a dull snoring. It’s kinda cute really. Ow. I grip my belly. Shit, Braxton hicks. Ugh. That’s not good. I’m only thirty weeks pregnant. I have to pee. I get up and walk towards the bathroom when my water breaks. Shit.

           “Tony!” I shout. He’s instantly sitting up.

           “What?” He looks over at me.

           “My water just broke. We need to go to the hospital.”

           “Oh, fucking shit.” He stands up and starts pulling on clothes. I call Pepper.

           “Hello?” she answers.

           “Can you come up and sleep in our bed? I need you to be with the kids. My water broke.” I explain. I sound calm but I’m freaking out.

           She agrees, and I hang up.

           Tony and I make our way to the garage and into the first car we see. On the drive to the hospital, Tony’s like a bat out of hell.

           At the hospital we’re rushed back to the room where I’m going to have my c section. Laying on the table and waiting for Dr. Moe to take the babies out feels like centuries. I just want to know if my babies are okay.

           “Here’s baby one!” she shouts suddenly. I hear a shrill crying and part of me sighs. Tony squeezes my hand. The nurses take her off the be weighed and cleaned. I’m sure she’s going to the NICU.

           “Baby two!” another shout comes two minutes later. Another little cry. Thank the lord. One more to go.

           Then…silence. A nurse gasps. What’s going on? Oh my god. What’s happening? There’s scuffling and a shout from Dr. Moe to give her some space.

           “What’s going on?” I ask franticly.

           The nurse that gasps looks over the sheet at me. “The umbilical cord is wrapped around baby three’s neck.” No.

           After a few more moments Dr. Moe yells “Baby three is out.” There’s no cry. Tears are streaming down my face. Another nurse takes baby three away.

           “My baby! Save her! Please!” I shout.

           Once I’m all put back together again, I’m rolled into my room. I’m so scared. I hug myself. Tony is yelling at a nurse that wasn’t even in the room when I gave birth.

           Ten minutes pass.

           Twenty minutes.

           Finally, Dr. Moe comes in. We stare at each other for a moment then…

           “We couldn’t save the third baby. I’m sorry for your loss.” She whispers.

           I cover my face with my hands and cry.

           “I’m handling it.” I say, not looking away from Jack. Pepper takes Tony by the shoulder and escorts him into the hallway to tell him what happened.

           “Do you understand what I’m saying, Jack?”

           “Yes Mama, I’m sorry.” I dry his tears away and kiss his forehead.

           “Why don’t you put in a movie and watch it with your brothers?” I suggest.

           “Okay come on Eli, come on Hudsie.” He takes Eli’s hand and James takes Hudson’s hand and they make their way out into the common room. I hear Pepper say that she’ll make them popcorn.

           I hug myself. In the last twenty weeks since we went to the doctor, James had shown signs of being able to control machines. When we tested it out with one of Tony’s suits, he made it fly without it being on in the first place. We triple checked it wasn’t Friday.

           Tony comes in and rubs my belly. “It’ll be okay.”

           “Will it?”

* * *

           I can’t sleep. I look at the clock again. 1:16. Great. I roll over towards Tony. He’s snoring. It isn’t so bad. Just a dull snoring. It’s kinda cute really. Ow. I grip my belly. Shit, Braxton hicks. Ugh. That’s not good. I’m only thirty weeks pregnant. I have to pee. I get up and walk towards the bathroom when my water breaks. Shit.

           “Tony!” I shout. He’s instantly sitting up.

           “What?” He looks over at me.

           “My water just broke. We need to go to the hospital.”

           “Oh, fucking shit.” He stands up and starts pulling on clothes. I call Pepper.

           “Hello?” she answers.

           “Can you come up and sleep in our bed? I need you to be with the kids. My water broke.” I explain. I sound calm but I’m freaking out.

           She agrees, and I hang up.

           Tony and I make our way to the garage and into the first car we see. On the drive to the hospital, Tony’s like a bat out of hell.

           At the hospital we’re rushed back to the room where I’m going to have my c section. Laying on the table and waiting for Dr. Moe to take the babies out feels like centuries. I just want to know if my babies are okay.

           “Here’s baby one!” she shouts suddenly. I hear a shrill crying and part of me sighs. Tony squeezes my hand. The nurses take her off the be weighed and cleaned. I’m sure she’s going to the NICU.

           “Baby two!” another shout comes two minutes later. Another little cry. Thank the lord. One more to go.

           Then…silence. A nurse gasps. What’s going on? Oh my god. What’s happening? There’s scuffling and a shout from Dr. Moe to give her some space.

           “What’s going on?” I ask franticly.

           The nurse that gasps looks over the sheet at me. “The umbilical cord is wrapped around baby three’s neck.” No.

           After a few more moments Dr. Moe yells “Baby three is out.” There’s no cry. Tears are streaming down my face. Another nurse takes baby three away.

           “My baby! Save her! Please!” I shout.

           Once I’m all put back together again, I’m rolled into my room. I’m so scared. I hug myself. Tony is yelling at a nurse that wasn’t even in the room when I gave birth.

           Ten minutes pass.

           Twenty minutes.

           Finally, Dr. Moe comes in. We stare at each other for a moment then…

           “We couldn’t save the third baby. I’m sorry for your loss.” She whispers.

           I cover my face with my hands and cry.

summary: Brooklyn 99 Characters and their Marvel Counterparts
title: Brooklyn 99 Characters and their Marvel Counterparts
body:
ALRIGHT HEAR ME OUT

Jake Peralta: Scott Lang 

  • dorky, fun loving, can and will kick ass, gets excited around their heroes, wants to help save the day any way possible but especially if it’s gonna look cool

Amy Santiago: Peter Parker 

  • adorable losers, try hard to impress superiors, intelligent but awkward (in the best way), always tries to do what’s right

Charles Boyle: Clint Barton 

  • eternal messes who have impulse control issues but everyone loves them regardless

Rosa Diaz: Natasha Romanoff 

  • secretive, badass (bisexual) ladies, who love their friends and would die for them, but also laugh when they trip and fall on their faces

Terry Jeffords: Thor

  • literal rays of sunshine who make everyone’s day better, muscles as fuck but also gentle and kind, care about family above all else, Terry could 100% pick up Thor’s hammer tbh

Raymond Holt: Nick Fury (with a lil bit of Drax just because)

  • leaders who are a little cold at first but care for their teams greatly and give some grade A one liners, for the Drax part Holt just has difficulty reading situations lmao

Gina Linetti: Tony Stark

  • the baddest bitch around and will make sure everyone knows it

also

Doug Judy: Loki 

  • I don’t think I need to explain this one

summary: The Raven and the Hawk (8)
title: The Raven and the Hawk (8)
body:
Pairing: Clint x Raven (kinda. Finally)

Warnings: fluff

Raven was yawning before she even finished changing her clothes. It was to be expected given the amount of pain killers she was on, but she didn’t want to miss the opportunity to watch the movie with Clint.

By the time she reached the lounge, Clint was already there with beer and a bowl of popcorn. He looked over when he heard her walk in the room and smiled. “What do you want to watch?”

She shrugged her good shoulder as she snatched the blanket off the back of the chair and moved over to the couch to sit next to Clint. “Something I don’t have to think about. Explosions would be good.”

“Your wish is my command.” He flipped through the choices until he came to Red.

“I love this movie,” Raven said as she tried to fix the blanket with her one good hand. Obviously realizing her predicament, Clint helped her spread it out over her legs.

She sipped at her beer, occasionally holding it in her bad hand to get a handful of popcorn. They weren’t even a half hour into the movie before her eyelids started drifting shut.

Clint had been keeping one eye on Raven, knowing she’d had a long day and was undoubtedly doped up on painkillers. It didn’t take long for her eyes to start drifting shut for longer and longer periods of time.

“Hey,” he said softly and she turned to look at him. “You want me to escort you back to your room?”

She shook her head. “I don’t really want to be alone right now.” She said it so low, he wouldn’t have caught it if he hadn’t been listening for her response.

He smiled at her. “Then lay down. I’ll get you back to your room later.”

She nodded and went to lay with her head on the other end of the couch. He saw the moment she realized she would have to lay on her bad shoulder to lay that way. She sat back up.

“I’ve been told I’m pretty comfortable to cuddle with,” he said. He smiled again when her cheeks flushed pink. “Come on,” he added and patted his lap. “I’ll be on my best behavior. Promise.”

Finally, she nodded and leaned in his direction. She laid her head on his lap, her hand under her cheek. She sighed and smiled a little as she settled and got comfortable. His eyes continued to move between her and the screen. After a couple of minutes he started to run his fingers through her hair. When she didn’t complain, he continued. She was asleep by the time Marvin got the pig. And he’d joined her, his head leaning against the back of the couch, before the film ended.

“Guess you didn’t do it on purpose,” a familiar voice next to his ear had him jerking awake.

“What was your first clue?” he said as he looked over at Nat. Her admitting she was wrong was as close as he was going to get to an apology. He ran a hand down his face and blinked his eyes trying to wake up. “What time is it?”

“Eleven.” She climbed into a nearby chair and perched herself on the back of it. “How is she doing?”

Clint shrugged. “She didn’t make it long before she crashed out. I’m assuming she’s still pretty doped up. You know they always give you the good stuff the first day.”

“You need help getting her to her room?”

“No. I got it. I’ll see you tomorrow afternoon for training. I’m taking the morning off.”

Natasha nodded before climbing off the chair and giving him a little wave. “See you tomorrow, Barton.”

Clint looked down at the assassin sleeping peacefully with her head in his lap and smiled. He used two fingers to brush the hair off her face. “Wake up, little bird.”

“Don’t wanna,” she grumbled.

He nudged her gently in the back. “Come on, Sterling. Let’s get you to your bed. It’s got to be more comfortable than this.”

She groaned but started to push herself up. He helped brace her and move her to a sitting position. “Sorry I fell asleep on you.”

“If I minded, I wouldn’t have offered.” He stood and stretched before holding out a hand to her. She took it and he helped her to her feet, frowning when she wove unsteadily. “All right, that’s not going to work,” he said before scooping her up to carry her bridal style. He made sure her bad shoulder wasn’t the one resting against him.

He had been prepared for her to argue or pitch a fit but she surprised him by leaning her head against his chest. “Thanks, archer,” she said with a yawn.

“No problem, little bird. Let’s get you to bed.” He carried her down the hall to the elevator and pressed the button for her floor. When they reached her door, he stood her on her feet so she could open the door, but kept a hand wrapped around her waist to keep her steady.

He helped her inside and she immediately climbed up on the bed and laid down. He chuckled a little and moved over to at least take off her shoes. “Do you want me to get Nat to help you change?”

She shook her head. “Too tired.” She rolled onto her uninjured side and brought her knees up closer to her chest.

“Good night, Raven,” Clint said softly after watching her for a moment. He started to back out of the room but her soft voice stopped him.

“Clint,” she said and turned slightly so she could see him.

“Yeah?”

“Would you stay, just for a little bit?”

He studied her for a moment, surprised she would ask.

She must have mistook his hesitation for reluctance because she launched into an explanation. “It’s just that I’m not used to sleeping with my back to the room and the meds have my brain foggy and—”

He cut her off by stepping fully into the room and shutting the door. “You don’t have to explain, little bird. I’m just surprised you asked is all. Scoot over a bit.”

She moved closer to the wall to make room for him and he slid in behind her after taking off his shoes. He laid a hand on her waist, taking care to not injure her further. A sigh escaped her as she snuggled deeper into the bed.

“Go to sleep, Raven. I’ve got you.”
